  • Wide Strings.w

A minimal library for handling wide C strings.

§1. By "wide string", we mean an array of wchar_t. A pointer to this type is what is returned by an L-literal in ANSI C, such as L"look, I'm wide". A wide string is essentially a C string but with characters stored in full words instead of bytes. The character values should be Unicode code points.

We will do as little as possible with wide strings, and the following wrappers simply abstract the standard C library's handling. 

    int Wide::len(wchar_t *p) {
        return (int) wcslen(p);
    }

The function Wide::len is used in 4/taa (§2.3).

§2. On the rare occasions when we need to sort alphabetically we'll also call: 

    int Wide::cmp(wchar_t *A, wchar_t *B) {
        return wcscmp(A, B);
    }

The function Wide::cmp is used in 5/htm (§21).

§3. 

    int Wide::atoi(wchar_t *p) {
        return (int) wcstol(p, NULL, 10);
    }

The function Wide::atoi appears nowhere else.
